body_html:
Whenever you run Python and see a UnicodeDecodeError then it is almost certainly a mismatch between python 2 and python 3. This https://caffe2.ai/docs/faq.html#why-do-i-get-import-errors-in-python-when-i-try-to-use-caffe2 and the following few questions explain a little about how Python installations work, which can help you debug this. Try to make sure that you use only Python 2 everywhere or only Python 3 everywhere, including in all of the dependent python libraries like protobuf that you are using.

If you want to know why unicode causes problems you can see https://docs.python.org/3/howto/unicode.html#reading-and-writing-unicode-data . The crux of the problem is that the file you are reading in is (the net def) is not recognized as unicode, but that will usually be caused by mismatching python2/3 libraries somewhere or from weird effects between your python, and other system libraries like protobuf.

Try to make sure that you use only Python 2 everywhere or only Python 3 everywhere, including in all of the dependent python libraries like protobuf that you are using.
If you want to know why unicode causes problems you can see https://docs.python.org/3/howto/unicode.html#reading-and-writing-unicode-data . body:
Whenever you run Python and see a UnicodeDecodeError then it is almost certainly a mismatch between python 2 and python 3. This https://caffe2.ai/docs/faq.html#why-do-i-get-import-errors-in-python-when-i-try-to-use-caffe2 and the following few questions explain a little about how Python installations work, which can help you debug this. Try to make sure that you use only Python 2 everywhere or only Python 3 everywhere, including in all of the dependent python libraries like protobuf that you are using.

If you want to know why unicode causes problems you can see https://docs.python.org/3/howto/unicode.html#reading-and-writing-unicode-data . The crux of the problem is that the file you are reading in is (the net def) is not recognized as unicode, but that will usually be caused by mismatching python2/3 libraries somewhere or from weird effects between your python, and other system libraries like protobuf.
